Bot¶

class asynctwitch.Bot(**kwargs)¶

A basic Bot. All others inherit from this.

oauth
: Required[str]
The oauth code for your account
user
: Required[str]
Your username
prefix
: Optional[str]
The prefix for the bot to listen to. (default: !)
channel
: Optional[str, list]
The channel(s) to serve. (default: twitch)
client_id
: Optional[str]
The application Client ID for the kraken API.
cache
: Optional[int]
The amount of messages to cache. (default: 100)
admins
: Optional[list]
The usernames with full access to the bot.
allow_streams
: Optional[bool]
Allow music to play continuous streams
event_ban(user, tags)¶

Called when a user is banned.

event_clear()¶

Called when chat is cleared normally

event_host_start(channel, viewercount)¶

Called when the streamer starts hosting.

event_host_stop(viewercount)¶

Called when the streamer stops hosting.

event_message(rm)¶

Called when a message is sent

event_notice(tags)¶

Called on NOTICE events (when commands are called)

event_private_message(rm)¶

Called on a private message

event_roomstate(tags)¶

Triggered when channel chat settings change.

event_subscribe(message, tags)¶

Called when someone (re-)subscribes.

event_timeout(user, tags)¶

Called when a user is timed out.

event_user_deop(user)¶

Called when a user is de-opped

event_user_join(user)¶

Called when a user joins

event_user_leave(user)¶

Called when a user leaves

event_user_op(user)¶

Called when a user is opped

event_userstate(User)¶

Triggered when the bot sends a message.

load(path)¶
load(path)
Param:path - path to a config file
override(coro)¶

Allows for overriding certain functions

parse_error(e)¶

Called when something errors

play_file(file)¶

Plays audio. For this to work, ffplay, ffmpeg and ffprobe are required. These are downloadable from the ffmpeg website, and have to be in the same folder as the bot OR added to path.

play_ytdl(query, *, filename='song.flac', options={}, play=True)¶

Requires youtube_dl to be installed pip install youtube_dl

raw_event(data)¶

Called on all events after event_ready

start(tasked=False)¶

Starts the bot. This blocks all other code below it from executing, unless tasked is set to True

stop(exit=False)¶

Stops the bot and disables using it again. Useful for a restart command I guess
